result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Keith Boyden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and stayed
May be served under the Huber Law as long as the defendant reports and remains alcohol and controlled substance free.

miscConds.notes: To be paid during terms of probation
Defendant shall cooperate with, participate in, and successfully complete evaluations, treatment and counseling deemed appropriate by Agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Keith Boyden

records.addlTxt: Clerk emailed Court info at GCSD copy of JOC

2:13 PM Defendant Brandon Keith Boyden in court, in custody.  Attorney Jane Krueger Smith in court for Brandon Keith Boyden.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. State complied with Victim Witness Notification. The parties have a joint recommendation for a global resolution of this case. Plea Questionnaire filed and reviewed. Court advises defendant of rights.  Elements stated.  Factual basis found.  Defendant advised of U.S. non-citizen collateral consequences resulting in deportation, the exclusion of admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law. No Contest plea entered on count 1. The Court finds the defendant guilty of count 1. Counts 2, 3, and 4 are dismissed and read in. The Court accepts the joint recommendation. The court will impose and stay a 30 day jail sentence with 3 days sentence credit. Defendant placed on probation for 12 months. Defendant to comply with all terms and conditions as well as payment of costs. Defendant advised of post conviction relief.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Sent the CBS to the Green County Jail

Resisting; 2 cts Misd Bail Jumping; 1 ct felony Bail jumping
Issuing agency: MPD
May not possess or consume any intoxicants. May not enter establishments (to include bars, taverns, or other premises) whose primary purpose is the sale of intoxicants with the exception of gas stations and grocery stores.  May enter gas stations and grocery stores but may not go into the area where intoxicants are sold.  If defendant posts bond ,defendant shall immediately complete processing at the Monroe Police Department within 48 hours.

1:16 PM Defendant Brandon Keith Boyden appeared in custody  by video. Attorney Jane Krieger Smith appears specially on behalf of the defendant.  Matt Lantta on behalf of Craig Nolen. Court advises defendant of rights.  Court advises defendant of charges and penalties. Defendant given complaint.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
